column1: Bladorinand is one of the rejected names of Beleriand which J.R.R. Tolkien jotted down "on a page of rough working for the opening of the The Lay of Leithian" (of Leithian) when he was probably searching for a replacement of Broseliand

column2: Bladorinand is connected with Palúrien later known as Yavanna name Bladorwen the wide earth

column1: All in all there were eight of these names: Golodhinand
